text: From tap. Pours dark ponk and amber. Small pink head. Boysenberry. Fatty and sour fruity. Dry and citric. Mellow and citric. Dry and citric and fruity finish. Lasting fruity far finish.

From tap; beautiful light red color with medium pinkish head; aroma is berries, some grains, lactic sourness; taste is intense fruity, round, medium sour, some funk and a nice soft maltiness; texture is creamy with medium to high carbonation

14.05.2017, tap @ Koelschip:
Nice pink creamy mediumlasting head, deep reddish color. Aroma is rich and dry concentrated sour-ish fruity, masses of dark berries, grass, soda powder, berry skin, winegum, sorrel, minerals. Taste is dry sour-ish fruity, fruit salt, soda powder, sorrel, berry skin, minerals, sour dark berries, sorrel, minerals, citrus acid, grass. Medium bitterness, dry acidic mouthfeel. Nice.
At koelschip, pours deep red to purple with a nice head, aroma of cherries, vanilla, cheese, flavor is sour with lots of cherries, strawberries, cheese, medium bodied, great
Bottle. Purple pour with pink head. Super boysenberry, fruit, sour aromas. Flavors are wine, fruit, boysenberry tones.

750ml bottle from share.. Rich ruby red body capped by a small pink head. Aroma is full jelly jar beery freshness. Taste brings in wooden barrel notes, more of the fruity berry flavors, and the right amount of tartness. Another classic from De Garde.
750ml bottle pours out a deep ruby red topped with a pink head. Nose is great jammy berries oak barrel notes and some tartness. Taste is more of the nice sweet tart berry combo along with the oak.

750ml bottle @ Matts. Pours a lovely reddish purple colour with a small pink head. Nose is ample berries throughout. Flavour is quite tart while fading way to a huge berry flavour. The berry flavour is rather fresh like and full, Im really enjoying this as it has the right amount of sourness.
Bottle - Dark Berry, overripe fruit and almost a vanilla notes. Deep purple with a small white head. Flowery and perfumy red fruit with an acidic finish. Weird

Looks beautiful, with a deep purple. Not much head. Ok, so I get quite a bit of berry but also a fair bit of butyric. Fuck. On the palate, lots of berry, and a fair bit of tartness. The fruit lends a fair bit of sugars. The butyric isnt really there on the palate, so you can certainly drink it. But it is a bit harsh in the finish in terms of its acidity.

750mL bottle, pours a deep purple with a rich pink head. Aroma is super fruity, with heaps of boysenberries, light tartness, and a touch of pith. Flavour is immensely fruity, with heaps of tart and juicy boysenberries, lots of pith, some oak, and a little lacto. Very fruity -- the boysenberries are sure prominent. Very good.

RB Best. It pours purple with a thick light purple head. The aroma is bready with good berry quality. Doesnt smell like its going to be super sour. The flavor has good fruity tartness and a hint of bread. Very light bodied. Tasty stuff, but if theres gonna be this much fruit character, it probably needs a bit more body.

Bottle @ RateBeer Best 2017. Pours a deep red color with a small pinkish white head. Has a fruity sour tart boysenberry aroma. Fruity sour tart oaky boysenberry flavor. Has a fruity sour tart boysenberry finish.

From bottle at Ratebeer Best festival, Santa Rosa. Ruby red color with pink head. Malty and yeasty aroma, tart fruity, berries, herbal - spicy, wood. Light sweet and acidic taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

(Draught at the brewery) deep purple, fine deep purple bubbles that last forever, one of the prettiest beers Ive seen. Nose of sweet berry, that signature de Garde lacto and funk mix, oak barrel, touch of chewable vitamins, smells amazing. The taste is no slouch either. Full of berry character, lacto, balanced sourness, oak, yogurt and other funky stuff. Palate finish is delicious. Its super tart without being overwhelming.
[1/28/17] Bottle/Draught at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Purple, pink head. Amazing jammy berries, sour, funk, lemony, wonderful.

Bottle to taster at ØL Beercafe & Bottle Shop, Walnut Creek, CA. Pours a dakr purple with a minimal purple head. Aroma of sweet boysenberry. Taste is boysenberry, dark fruit, berries, oak, hints of funk. Tart finish. Excellent.
Aroma: boysenberry jam; Appearance: dark purple with no head; Taste: sweet, tart, makes mouth water; Palate: dry finish: overall: quite good.

Bottle at RBBest. Pours dark red with a pink foam. Aroma is light berries and dark fruit with some barrel notes. Again a lightly sour, tart and crisp beer. Fruity and refreshing. Stingy palate, but otherwise great.
At Ratebeer Best. Pours dark purple with an attractive purple head and a berry aroma. There is a slightly sour berry flavor with a dry tart finish.
Purple pour. Just like the imperial version, this tastes like the dannon boysenberry yogurts that I ate as a kid. Just juicy, tart and beyond drinkable. Wow. Again.

750ml shared by Levi. Purple red body. Purple-red tinged head. Big fruity tones match and complement the sour quite well. The sour is pleasantly not acetone tinged or vinegar. The boysenbery is super pronounced, making this quite a unique experience. More fruit beer than sour, but still lots of sour yeast. Great.

750ml bottle, had thsi in a blind taste test with 9 other fruits, guessed 6 out of 9, missed the marion, boysen, and cherry raz for obvious reasons in perception of these rare fruits. This one was pretty par for the course, thought it might have been strawberry.
Bright red. Tart aroma with great boysenberry aroma. Taste is puckering sour and that berry finish is incredible. Oak Barrell notes linger throughout the whole experience.

A- pours an Ocean Spray CranRasberry red. Delicate pink head that thins quickly. Very light lacing. 

S- lemons, grass, cranberry and boysenberry pie filling are all forward. Lots of berry jam. Some sour oak mustiness but fairly concealed. 

M- light tart body that goes down like a watery fruit juice. 

T- aromas set the precedent and flavors follow suit. Lemon head candies and very tart berries first. More grasses and dank wood. Light pepper, herbal and lacto qualities. A lot of water and acidic notes that drown out any subtle jam.

Not very complex but not necessarily to a fault. Could have used a little more fruit to generate a more present flavor.

Bottle at brewery, Tillamook. Pours a rich purple, little bit of head. Aroma fruity, with some lacto and and funk as well. Body well balanced and tart, lots of fruit but also lots of oak and general tartness. One of the better BUs.
Grape colored pour. Small light purple head. Little lacing. Big boysenberry aroma. Tart taste of boysenberry.
Bottle at Astoria share. Pours purplish pink. Nose/taste of fresh boysenberry, oak, tannins, red wine and sour lactose. Dryish. Lighter medium body.

[ Bottle ][ ½ of 75cl ][ Tasting ][ Trade ][ Snifter ][ 9.25.14 ]Translucent dark raspberry body, puffy pink head drops fast, thin cap, tepid appearance. The berry nose reminds of peppery grape, lightly spicy fennel element, light lime and chemical. Juicy front palate, jammy with light seed, the fennel elements returning mid with more citric acid that dominates, all together very well-rounded. The full bodied finish is too fizzy, reducing it to a high acid citric finish, tons of dry skin all over the mouth, sticky and biting, so fizzy it numbs the tongue.[ 9.25 Tasting Ranking ] 01. New Glarus R&D Sour Fruit02. De Garde Blackberry Whiskey Bu03. Bayerischer Bahnhof Berliner Style Weisse04. De Garde Boysenberry Bu 05. Side Project Fencerow06. De Garde Blackberry Bu07. Jester King Nocturn Chrysalis08. Almanac Farmers Reserve Blackberry 09. Crooked Stave Blackberry Dark Origins

Bottle. Pours crystal clear ruby magenta, small pink head, little lacing. Aroma is strung fruity, blueberry, boisenberry, herbal, jammy. Flavor is light sweet, dry finish, light tart, just a hint of funk. Medium body. A bit minerally.

Pour is very dark purple, mostly clear, with a pink head. Nose has a really bright jammy aroma with an interesting spice of lemon grass. Taste is a bit sweeter, the berry jam starts to creep towards the edge of being sweet but still quite jammy. The spicy lemon grass is mild and comes in towards the back. Softer body, fairly delicate, moderate carb, semi dry finish.

Nice purple. Light head. Smells like berry jam! Smells incredible. So much fruit. Nose is insane. So fruity. Taste. Like other brews. Sharp and faded fast the fruit really shines. Like eating sour berry jelly

Bottle thanks to Chow. Pours a cloudy purple with small frothy white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is a strong berry and oak. Thin mouthfeel with nice tart berry, oak, light acidity, easy to drink, yes.

Bottle... Muckfest 2014... Pours murky and deep red with a small, fizzy, pink head. The nose is restrained, but fruity. Medium-bodied and creamy with pillow-soft carbonation. The flavor is fruity and sour; packed with big boysenberry character and a mild lemon aspect. Refreshing, super-tart finish.

Bottle shared by Brandon! Pour is deep reddish purple with a thin pink head. Aroma Is light berry, light tartness, and a touch of cherry kool-aid. Flavor is sweet with tart berry hints and light kool-aid. Thinner body. Nice and clean. Not complicated but really solid.

750ml bottle. Dark beautiful ruby purple color. Jammy lemon berries. Deep, rich, tart. Tart, blackberry, lemon, funky oak. Funky deep jammy fruit. Sharp berry, lemon tartness, minerals, deep and rich...awesome.

Huge fresh boysenberry nose. Juicy jammy awesome fresh rad. Berliner Weiss underneath lemon wheat. Mostly just juice. Purplish pour no head and lace. Flavors of tart dark berry lemony wheat. Tons of dark berry freshness. Jammy awesomeness! Rare. Bvc the beer coach is like bill Walsh to the west coast offense. Handing out rare rates like Super Bowls and touchdowns. Bitch.

Bottle sample at Muckfest V on 7/12/14. Thanks Pud! Clear red in color with a thin off-white head. Aroma of funk, berry and malt. Sour fruit flavor with some nice herbal character before a sour finish.

Bottle - pours ruby red. Aroma is berries, sour, and tart. The taste is wheaty, tart, boysenberry, and grapes. It's pretty good but nothing great. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle shared by Puddintane - thanks again, Pudd! This one pours such a deep, lovely ruby color - nearly purple - with a small, tinted head. Big, deep, rich berry nose, with florals, grass, yogurt. The flavor brings even more rich berries, with tannins, oak, grass, florals, yogurt, and some acidity. Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a fruity, tart, acidic mouthfeel. Wow, this actually stands above the rest of the Bu lineup.
Beautiful in the glass. Purple with violet foam. Spritzy. Raspberry aromas and sharp acidic feel. Light tannic astringency. Well done

Poured from bottle to tulip glass. Hazy red hue with white fizzy head. Aroma is berries, acetic, lactic, straw, metallic. Mouthfeel is nice with a light body and sharp carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness throughout with a nice sour tartness that extends in the finish. Overall this is a really nice fruit sour.
